channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In Peak Election Season, the Stock Market Is Often Fickle. Be Patient.
item.description: With the political conventions behind us and a rate cut expected soon, the market has been rallying, yet our columnist says it’s safer to play a longe...

item.title: Volcano Erupts Near Fishing Town in Iceland
item.description: The latest eruption, the sixth since December, is part of increased volcanic activity that began in 2021.

item.title: Millennial U.K. lawyers are getting a $50,000 bonus for referring their friends to U.S. giants, despite the inevitable burnout
item.description: U.S. firms have rolled out massive referral bonuses after upping starting salaries to beyond $200,000.

item.title: Nepal Asks China to Turn a Loan for Pokhara Airport Into a Grant
item.description: A new government in Nepal formally asked for relief from a $216 million debt it incurred for construction of an airport in Pokhara that has been beset...

item.title: Middle East Crisis: With $20 Billion Weapons Deal, U.S. Aims to Help Israel and Deter Iran
item.description: The White House, which has told Congress it is allowing a large package of future arms sales to Israel, has tried to contain opposition to the deal wh...

item.title: Starbucks’ incoming CEO Brian Niccol will immediately have more power than ousted boss Laxman Narasimhan
item.description: Only after an intense period of shadowing Howard Schultz did Laxman Narasimhan gain the ability to set the company’s strategy.

item.title: Why Kamala Harris’s Centrism is Working
item.description: The vice president’s convention speech embodied her efforts to win over swing voters.

item.title: Nepal Lifts Ban on TikTok, in a Likely Overture to China
item.description: The move signaled that Nepal’s new prime minister, who has cultivated ties with China, would continue on that path.

item.title: When it comes to crime, crypto is a powerful tool for law enforcement
item.description: Coinbase's Chief Security Officer makes a case for why law enforcement should prefer crypto to cash.

item.title: Harris Makes Her Case, and the New Covid Vaccine
item.description: Plus, an aquarium bids farewell to a queer icon.

item.title: Modi Arrives in Kyiv as Ukraine Pushes Diplomacy
item.description: Ukrainian officials were portraying the visit by Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India as a welcome show of support for their country during the war w...

item.title: Tokyo’s tax office is auctioning off a $390,000 Ferrari and a golf course
item.description: Tokyo's tax agency seized a 2-seater Ferrari NV 488 Pista Spider with an estimated price of 56.8 million yen ($390,000) from an owner who failed to pa...

item.title: The Biggest Speech of Kamala Harris’s Career
item.description: Presenting herself as a pragmatic leader who could unite all Americans behind a “new way forward,” Vice President Kamala Harris accepted the Democrati...

item.title: Mapping Ukraine’s Surprise Invasion of Russia
item.description: Ukraine has captured dozens of Russian settlements, adding a new twist to a war that had largely settled into grueling fighting in eastern Ukraine.

item.title: Nestle CEO Mark Schneider steps down after steering the ship for eight years—to be replaced by Latin American boss
item.description: The Nespresso coffee capsules and Haagen-Dazs ice cream manufacturer lowered its sales growth outlook for 2024 last month as it slowed its price incre...
